messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Used Book Sources
messages.msgSnippet: Here, here! (a newer, but fellow quilter) Bonnie From: Terri  Allen  Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com To:
messages.messageBody:
Here, here! (a newer, but fellow quilter)

Bonnie


From: "Terri Allen" <kscajuns@...>
Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Used Book Sources
Date: Sun, 27 May 2001 13:49:05 -0500

Betsy,

you're a woman after my own heart--

a true kindred spirit---

You can NEVER have too much fabric!!

(you must be a fellow quilter?)

( c ;
Terri
----- Original Message -----
From: Betsy Hill
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, May 26, 2001 4:20 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Used Book Sources


>P.S. When typing in www.bookfinder.com, don't accidentally put an "s"
after
>bookifinder (thus creating "bookfinders" ) unless you're in the mood for
a

>sleazy thrill. <g>

Thanks, Becky! Now I can find either books OR sleazy thrills whenever I
need 'em.

(And since it's also possible to shop for fabric online, I'm now in hog
heaven.)

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: Used Book Sources
messages.messageBody:
<<
I have a very negative impression of the Amazon rare book search
capability. Bibliofind used to be consistently better / cheaper.

Have you ever used abe.books? >>

Hi, Betsy,

I sell used children's books as for "egg money" and was disgusted to find
out what happened to Bibliofind, not only due to the increase in prices but
because their search engine is much less useful, right now. :-( I've
bought things from ABE in the past; no problems. It seems the best bet, now
that Bibliofind is "gone", might be www.bookfinder.com, which searches for
both new AND old copies of your target book, and has a very wide range.
There's another good site, http://www.addall.com/, that many of my fellow
Used Bookies use....I haven't bought from them, though. And there's
www.tomfolio.com.

AND there's a brand new Ebay-clone JUST for books, paper, and ephemera,
with free listing for the remainder of the year, but I can't quite remember
the name, so I'll have to go dig it up and get back to you. :-)

P.S. When typing in www.bookfinder.com, don't accidentally put an "s" after
bookifinder (thus creating "bookfinders" ) unless you're in the mood for a
sleazy thrill. <g>


*** Becky***

"Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and
conscientious stupidity."

Martin Luther King Jr. (1929 - 1968), Strength to Love, 1963
